result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamison Hiler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
CORRECTED 07-24-2017:  CFTS (balance of credit to be applied to 16CF1687)

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not possess or consume any controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must get GED or HSED. Must pay child support. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jamison  Hiler in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Jamison  Hiler in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State has made a global offer but defense indicates that deft hasn't decided if he wants to take the deal or go to trial. The State asks for MG on 15CF398 as well as JT date. Defense asks for about 10 days for deft to make a decision. The State revokes all offers.
Defense now indicates deft wishes to take advantage of the State's offer.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jamison  Hiler in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Jamison  Hiler in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense met with the State and a global resolution was worked out. Defense was prepared to ask for more time to discuss the offer but indicates deft wishes him to withdraw. Ms. Tanck-Adams objects to Mr. Games withdrawing and indicates that the deft asks attorney's to withdraw when it comes time to make a decision. The Court conducts colloquy with the deft.

BTC: Request for Mr. Gamez to withdraw is denied. Matter to be set for STC in 30 days and either the matters will resolve, matter to be set for trial or some substantive information is to be presented to the Court.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jamison  Hiler in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Jamison  Hiler in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State indicates that Mr. Gamez would like to speak with Ms. Tanck-Adams regarding these matters. Defense asks for a 2 week adj to allow Mr. Gamez to speak to the State about a global resolution  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jamison  Hiler in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Jamison  Hiler in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State asks to hold the bond forf in abeyance. Defense asks bond forf to be determined to day and also asks for a date in about 30 days to allow him time to get discovery. Defense indicates that the poster of the bond is here and asks that bond be returned and a new bond set. 

BTC: bond forf decision is held in abeyance. Vacate BW.  Status conference scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.
spoke to RCSO @ 9:00am

TO TRACK WITH OTHER CASES  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator) between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340, in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator). Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
